data.title: seasonal and local cuisine
data.text: A very nice restaurant in our little downtown area. Cozy atmosphere and sophisticated cuisine. They make an effort to serve local products when available and menu varies seasonally. Great soups!

data.title: Impressed
data.text: Definitely go. Would like to go back and try more of the menu. Cool modern decor, great prompt service. Had two really good meals and many more selections I would like to try. Two dinners and dessert $50 before tip. 4.5 stars.

data.title: Usual Great Dining Experience
data.text: I dined here while preparing to perform with my jazz trio.  I always eat first and this was the usual top notch food.  Rhonda waited on me and was her usual charming self.  She advised me correctly that the appetizer I was looking at might be too much with the vegetarian meal that I was ordering.  I had a beet and black bean kofte that was served with rice and cucumber/tomato salad.  It was very tasty and I do hope that they continue to offer vegetarian options.  The beer selection also rotates frequently and Rhonda had me try a red ale, which was quite tasty.  I do also enjoy the seafood entrees but the vegetarian ones are unique and always worth trying.  I am a regular.

data.title: Pre Theatre Dinner
data.text: Part of a group of 5 who ordered many different things from an unusually good menu -- Beef Bourguignon, Salmon, Linguini special for the night, Autumn Salad, Lamb Meatballs and the White Bean Soup.  All got rave reviews!!  Not a huge wine list but a good variety and reasonably priced.  Our server was Katie and she was exceptional.  Overall, a great meal.

data.title: Saturday night
data.text: The place used to be much better. Filet was good but not a lot of flavor. Had to ask for bread basket. Martinis were mediocre.

data.title: Great find!
data.text: We discovered this place on our way into town and we were pleasantly surprised by the cool, hip atmosphere. Food was delicious. Wine great!  Kristen was our server and she was knowledgeable and professional. We will definitely come back!

data.title: Romantic anniversary dinner
data.text: While visiting family in Ohio our anniversary snuck up on us.  We wanted to go out by ourselves and looked on the internet for a nice restaurant in the area.  Saw Seasons and thought it looked perfect.  We made a reservation and when we walked in we were immediately seated .  It was a cozy little table.  A very personable waiter took our order and brought us very good martinis.  The bison burgers were perfectly cooked and came out to us in record time.  Thank you for a wonderful anniversary dinner!  Perfect!

data.title: Trendy restaurant
data.text: Great for small groups up to 8. This is not an eat-and-go restaurant. Enjoy a drink and relax. The food is well presented and tasty.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The food is always good. The service is sometimes slow. There is not usually enough staff to facilitate the quantity of people. If you're there for a quick lunch thus is the wrong place. If you have time to spare,I suggest going.  The food is delicious.  They are never stingy with portions or flavors.

data.title: Thursday evening Dinner in Springfield
data.text: We prepared and nice presentation. The shrimp and avocado stack appetizer was outstanding. I had the Tunisian lamb dish which was nicely prepared and unique. The pasta special was my husbands choice and his plate was cleaned and then he helped my finish my generous portion of lamb. White chocolate mousse for dessert capped off the evening. We would definitely go back if we're in the area.

data.title: Very Nice Restaurant
data.text: We both had meals that included a salad, entree, and dessert.  I had the Brisket and my wife had the Risotto.  Both meals were very good and the price was really reasonable.  Service was great. Recommend for couples or a family.

data.title: Big City Taste with Midwestern Service
data.text: You will find the atmosphere both inviting and trendy.  Meet friends for a cocktail at the bar or bring your adult family out for a well prepared meal.  Families with young kids are welcome, but the food may be more inviting to adult taste.  A can't miss.

data.title: High quality food
data.text: We enjoyed our meal here, the food was high quality and flavorful. Got there at 6 pm on a Friday and were almost the only ones there. Strange that they seated us in the tiniest table against the wall. It did get a bit busier as the evening went on but it wasn't overly crowded. Good service, our waitress was very informative about the menu. The only thing was, we were tired and the whole experience took almost 2 hours. We ordered drinks, appetizers, entrees and desserts for 2 and with the tip spent $98.

data.title: Good food locals frequent
data.text: Middle age locals tend to enjoy the good food and drink at this find restaurant.  A small establishment with bison burgers, lamb, steak, fish, pasta, interesting salads and lovely desserts.

data.title: ?Seasons
data.text: Downtown Springfield appears to be quiet on Friday Night.  Just right for me and my wife, son and daughter in law.  As we pull up to park, we see a beautiful downtown that has been preserved over the years.  I can recall what it looked like 50 years ago and it is the same with some improvement.  As we enter the Seasons, you can see historic photos of long ago. Next, you will be greeted by one or more, we got in early so it was Three Greeters for us. The interior is beautiful and well maintained, a full dinning area and a VERY LONG BAR. It did not take long to fill up with customers. The food and service was very good.  Don't miss this place. I would not have even looked downtown if it were not for Trip Advisor.  Thanks for the tip.

data.title: Eclectic menu and lovely service and setting
data.text: This is a lovely restaurant.  We went on a busy Saturday night and were seated right away despite not having a reservation. We really enjoyed the fresh, well-dressed salads and a delicious pasta shell dish. Service was great and friendly, and the ambience is lovely.  Would definitely go again!

data.title: Fine Dining with Atmosphere
data.text: Nice variety and professional service in intimate setting. Cut above most offerings locally.  Great taste and quality.

data.title: A great find
data.text: What a great experience. The friendliest place I've been.  Ambience was good, service exceptional, but most of all the food was superb. My wife had a curried shrimp dinner and I had a trout dish.  I must say for two people who dine out frequently, the trout was the best and most plentiful I have ever had. We won't hesitate to go back again.

data.title: Impressively fantastic
data.text:
OVERALL: As a self professed food snob from Boston I was truly impressed with the entree here. I haven't been anywhere else in town, but don't imagine you could do much better. 

PROs
Bibimbap Korean Beef Rice bowl is one of the best dishes I've had all year

Old fashioned was good (light on bourbon)

Apricot tart dessert was on par with a nice new york Italian bakery

CONs
House salad was very average, but at only $3.50 you can't complain too much. 

For being half full the service was VERY slow at the bar

data.title: Always happy with my meal
data.text: A good place for lunch or dinner. Casual-smart. Good drinks, usually good service and good food. One of the waitresses often has this look on her face like she's going to smack someone...not sure if this is her normal look:-) Otherwise a good place ( worth 5 stars)to have a decent meal - not overpriced either. Don't bother with dessert - we have never been thrilled with that turn out.
